source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac: metaphysics treats everything in general before observing anything in particular > Condillac’s new metaphysics will resemble empiricism, be called metaphysics only by analogy

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, “bad” metaphysics must be corrected by new theory of signs and words, by using another language

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: philosophy is historical for Condillac: it always comes after cognition, after a scientific discovery; his philosophical method can only be established après coup—or stroke (coup) of genius

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, metaphysics, psychology, outside of usage, good use; Condillac: “I would call it psychology, if I knew any good work under this title”

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Locke inaugurates—but after Bacon & Newton (philosophy records pre-existence of good minds), philosophers are the first to recognize genius (Locke recognized Bacon)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: by preceding analogically, he discovered an unknown > invention by analogy (or analysis): new “objects” created by transposing, proportioning, analyzing

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: how can Locke carve out a trail while repeating an earlier rupture? he applied a general law to particular domain

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: sensationalist metaphysics, via analogic, develops into semiotism: sign unfolds (développe) germ

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, sensation is unmodifiable, first material, immediate presence, but also a germ for analogic sign > degrees of intensity, combinative energetics, good analogy, “identical proportions”

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Derrida defends Condillac against Foucault’s assessment of a “deficiency,” “epistemological myths” > perhaps Condillac’s maintenance of calculus & genesis resists a classical opposition; Derrida then notes [re: relevance to scientific modernity]: imaginary upsurging of one epistēmē, its finitude, table, sets terrain for theory of general epistēmē, which makes table its determining norm [see Bennington’s Scatter p. 11]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: the simplifying criticism of Condillac works on a lever of disorganization, works at ruining alternative btwn genesis & calculus—w/ disconcerting regularity in determined situation [implying Condillac’s theory of delay, these criticisms can only be read after the fact]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac’s corpus vulnerable, open, to violent self-serving operations [e.g. de Biran], innocently called lapses in reading: dissolving alternative opposition [btwn genesis/calculus] because unable to find literal rule of its [system’s working] statement

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for de Biran, no progress possible for Condillac’s system: its central deficiency will make it stall btwn 2 lapses

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: de Biran's criticism of Condillac’s arbitrary also a criticism of rationalism, of alchemism (reduction to the gold of abstract, simple, fundamental element [ego]), of idealism

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: to point to a “hesitation” in a text “marks a reading’s empiricist limit” [re: de Biran’s critique of Condillac]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: both Condillac and de Biran take repetition for granted, rule of indecision never comes to conception (au concept), a limit which is the concept not a concept: thus, Condillac finds contradiction in activity/passivity, de Biran duplicity in Condillac’s “hesitation”

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: both Condillac and de Biran take repetition for granted, rule of indecision never comes to conception (au concept), a limit which is the concept not a concept: thus, Condillac finds contradiction in activity/passivity, de Biran duplicity in Condillac’s “hesitation”

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for undergrads, Condillac’s thought limited to statue’s petrified hardheadedness, evanescence of rose’s scent

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: simplifying criticism of Condillac, history of reading Condillac, linked to formation of University & its models of philosophical teaching

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac: new philosophy must clothe itself in scholastic rags, “can we presume the professors will renounce what they think they know in order to learn what they do not know?”

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: here Condillac represents history as history of the university

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: combinative concept of generation indispensable for Condillac’s critique of innatism: innatists choose btwn classifying innate ideas (calculus) & empiricism of genesis (engendering)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: invention of a new science: “new combinations” exist (new science at once example and discovery of this) > generative or combinative model (separately) insufficient

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: genius as trailblazing (frayage); Condillac: “we do not properly create any ideas; we only combine, by composing & decomposing” > Condillac still distinguishes genius (gives birth to new science, new branch, new art) from talent

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, philosopher forms new combination of ideas re: combination of ideas

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac resists opposition btwn continuist/discontinuist, evolutionist/epigeneticist histories (deconstructs them almost by itself) > double gesture: generates a new science & theory of general conditions for upsurge of a theory [new science]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: genius finds what know one could find before, but various forms of finding (different origins of each science): find, discover, invent, come or light upon (rencontrer)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, [the fact of facts] sensibility/experience due to original sin [historicity?]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac: genius can only prosper when language is not defective, when it’s easy/convenient, when a language has fixed principles—this is an epocha of great men

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: archeology of frivolous is deviation of genius; Condillac: [periods of decline] man “of genius” deviates from analogy, reign of frivolous turns, far-fetched expressions, neologisms

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac’s theory [where there is history]: imagination retraces: produces as reproduction the lost object of perception, brings to light what will have been there

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: if there were only (natural, national) genius and progress of language—no history? > if genius is pure rupture, discontinuity, can’t be reduced to its own conditions—no history

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: passage (continuity and/or rupture) from one operation to an other always amounts to difference, quantity, of force > via analogy, this quantity of force is always that of connection

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Derrida sees here a silent explosion in text or fission in each concept (Condillac, elsewhere, denounces obscurantist force of “metaphor” [hence analogical value])

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: innovation as revelation, analysis as analogical process, energy connecting present to absent > concept of force as force of repetition (retracing, supplying)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, primitive sense of force, attraction (a force that draws), proceeds from feeling of effort (sensible, physical), is transferred “figuratively” to metaphor [Derrida exposes how de Biran overplays notion of force in Condillac, which Condillac denounces elsewhere]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: another disappropriation, fission, in 2 concepts of imagination, tampers w/ very concept of what disappropriates [re: Condillac]: 1. imagination as purely reproductive: disposition, material used by consciousness, perception 2. imagination as productive: force, free > new forms can be true or untrue (in order to supply, it adds something more)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: via Condillac, the history/narrative we produce re: “progress of language,” via the imaginations [productive, reproductive], always risks resembling a fable

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: mastery, if there is any, does not exist: it must possess what is not, never itself

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: [re: Condillac’s ambiguity of 2 imaginations] major strategic operation of mastery is to control ambiguity & risks, the strategy is almost mastery itself

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac’s non-Cartesian indubitability: first property which knows itself (sensibility)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac: if there is fundamentally only one machine, there is fundamentally only one property > unique property assures possibility of “identical propositions,” this self-evident identity (nontautological) is discovered by way of Reason, is “the only sign of evidence” > all modifications are those of first property modifying itself: sensibility

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac transposes Newtonian discourse [into the mind (l’âme) as general principle of analogy?]: analogy creates language & method

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: that math can be a model for analogy: unlimited generality of principle of analogy

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac: men of genius, favorite disciples of nature, make language seem less arbitrary—method of invention is only analogy itself (analogy: art of reasoning & speaking)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, philosophers who were geometers (the least mathematical) think too synthetically (contra analytically) (Leibniz, Descartes, Mallebranche), Locke was not a geometer

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Locke, acc. Condillac, missed the sign as principle of unfolding [sensible] germ, did not radically analyze germ/seed

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac’s failure to go straight to principle of order, a fault of composition: he did not go straight to it > following order = discovering order: s’abyme, encircles history w/ nature [Husserl?]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: ensemble of rules, method: so to repeat science & multiply discoveries

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, Descartes’ success: taught us his method of self-reflection so it could be perpetuated [methodological operation as revolutionary operation]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: after Condillac admits he had to take great detours, Derrida explains that the sign is the name of this detour, experience itself as detour, generation of suppléance to be retraced

content: Condillac considered theory of signs (analogy) in Essay, its most original advance

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: insistence (quantity/quality of insistence), force, not a secondary value in philosophical discourse

content: force, analogy, signification will always be ordered to a theory of need (don’t rush to oppose to theory of desire)

content: for Condillac, chain of signs is superstructural, & its principle is formal

content: understanding vs. will > another matrical opposition

content: for Condillac, theoretical knowledge can be remarked, noted, signed, thus he is critical of all unconscious perception (practical knowledge) > remarking remarked against unconsciousness in general [Condillac’s critique of Leibniz, who Condillac knew insufficiently]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, btwn reason/instinct only a difference in degree: reason is instinct

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: acc. Condillac, theoretical is only a supplying remark (remarque suppléante) of the practical

content: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)

content: only arbitrary signs > sign’s active essence, its energy: freedom

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, frivolity as structural destiny, original sin > an accident as essential fate

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac against frivolous obscurantism, erudition, against philosophers (inventors of prose) who did not “witness[ ]…impressions they caused” (unlike poets, orators), nor did they find rule of their discourse in “live interchange” > frivolous style is that of the written

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac: the science Aristotle called ζητουμéνη (desired, sought after) is the general knowledge of soul on which all sciences depend (what science of happiness is to the arts), this science opens future, providence—so wise man is not stuck in present

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: frivolity originates from deviation or gap of signifier, also from its folding back on itself in closed, nonrepresentative identity

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: repetitive structure of knowing gives rise to archeological interpretation of frivolous & to a metaphysics of plagiarism [Derrida quotes Condillac on plagiarism]

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: we escape frivolity only at semantic risk of nonidentity; Condillac names nonidentity metaphor, makes it the primordial structure of language to begin its analogical/teleological reappropriation

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: Condillac: need as uneasiness caused by absence of object you deem necessary [lack], this uneasiness determines actions of body’s/soul’s faculties, this determination is desire

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: via Condillac, need is system’s unique principle, desire is its representative vection: need changes into desiring representation in temporal dehiscence of comparison

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, there is no difference in general, only of degrees > this proposition comes to unfold (déplier) all concepts of rupture/repetition, this unfolding is time’s

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: the frivolous: (time of a) difference (of degree), spacing which ontology isn’t capable of, con-, de-struction are breached, line of disintegration (not straight/continuous/regular); philosophy deviates from itself, strikes itself w/ blows from outside > deconstruction is possible

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: for Condillac, degree, gradual difference, ruins “identical proposition,” dislocates is > yet, degree also makes synthesis of “identical proposition” possible (prohibiting frivolity, advancing knowledge)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: via Condillac, the sign’s vacancy (a frivolous one), suspension of its relation to object, intervenes before the sign: sign announced before sign

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: frivolous extension (leaves idea w/out thing, sign w/out idea) increases w/ progress itself, follows teleological movement > extends to limit of what it disintegrates: commerce, language, institution

content: a “stretched sense” always risks being empty, [the analogic of the sign], means we never escape 2 imaginations, 2 identities, 2 metaphysics, 2 barbarisms > always a double or stand-in for idea itself: frivolity’s last/first garment

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: need or desire? 1) frivolity comes to need through desire, desire opens direction of object, produces supplying (suppléante) sign, is thin, slight, inconstant 2) need is frivolous, need w/out desire is blind, no object, identical to itself, tautological, autistic: in such a case, desire would moralize need, subject it to law

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: but don’t forget: in human order, w/ language, commerce, and supplementary deflection, the 2nd is 1st (metaphysics as humanism) > the need to desire (does not belong to nature)

source.title: The Archeology of the Frivolous: Reading Condillac

content: [re: need to desire, desire as end w/out end] moment stone (statue) comes to life, works to reduce gap, (not) become dead again—contrary to frivolous distraction, to headstrong identity of signs: fear of Medusa, legitimacy itself [fear of frivolous = fear of Medusa?]
